para_sentences.para_0: Being able to trace the flow of execution through a given piece of code and tell how it will behave, is a critical skill for reading and understanding code, as well as for debugging. Here are four common methods people use to help them do this:
para_sentences.para_1: All of these are worth being comfortable with.

ol_0: Hand-tracing is just stepping through the code as if you were the computer  going along line by line  and keeping track of the current values of all the variables as they change
Temporarily inserting print statements at various places in your code can also be useful for checking what values variables referred to at those points
Many programming environments provide a built-in debugger  which lets you look at the current values of the different variables to see how they change as you step through the code line by line
Explaining how your code works to someone else can often give you an "Aha!" moment where it helps you see a disconnect between what your code is supposed to do and what it actually does
